alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Gadsden; Jackson (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 2:20PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Jackson and northeastern Calhoun Counties in the Panhandle of Florida, northwestern Gadsden County in Big Bend of Florida, southwestern Decatur and south central Seminole Counties in southwestern Georgia through 300 PM EDT/200 PM CDT/... At 220 PM EDT/120 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Chattahoochee, or 18 miles northeast of Blountstown, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Greensboro, Chattahoochee, Sneads, Gretna, Grand Ridge, Ocheesee, Juniper, Douglas City, Mount Pleasant, Hardin Heights, Rosedale, Recovery, Faceville, Hardaway, Jinks, Sycamore, Cypress, Alliance, Torreya State Park and Sawdust. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
